questions.text: Ottawa Charter of health promotion incorporates all of the following key action areas except
Which of the following is a Mortality Indicator?
In a village with population of 5000, 50 people have a disease and 10 of then died, What is case fatality rate?
50 people are suffering from cholera in a population of 5000. Out of 50, suffering from cholera, 10 died. But the total deaths are 50. What is the death rate?
10% of total deaths in a city is due to accidents. There are 500 total deaths reported. What is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Out of total deaths 50 are due to accidents.

questions.correct_answer: B. Out of total deaths 50 are due to accidents.

questions.text: Which is best in order to make a comparison between 2 populations?

Prevalence of a disease:

options.label: A
options.text: Is the best measure of disease frequency in etiological studies

options.label: B
options.text: Can only be determined by a cohort study

options.label: C
options.text: Is the number of new cases in a defined population

options.label: D
options.text: Describes the balance between incidence, mortality and recovery

questions.correct_answer: D. Describes the balance between incidence, mortality and recovery

questions.text: If the prevalence is very low as compared to the incidence for a disease, it implies:

options.label: A
options.text: Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

options.label: C
options.text: Calculation of prevalence & incidence is wrong

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing can be said, as they are independent

questions.correct_answer: A. Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

Which of the following statements is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: A cohort study is more expensive in comparison to case control study

options.label: B
options.text: A cohort study starts with people exposed to risk factor or suspected cause while case control study starts with disease

options.label: C
options.text: A long follow- up period often needed with delayed results in a cohort study whereas a case control study yields relatively quick results

options.label: D
options.text: A cohort study is more appropriate when the disease under investigation is rare, in comparison to case control study

questions.correct_answer: D. A cohort study is more appropriate when the disease under investigation is rare, in comparison to case control study

questions.text: A study revealed that in a study group, intake of betacarotene decreases carcinoma of colon but it actually may be due to increased intake of dietary fibre. This is due to:
True about confounding factor except

options.label: A
options.text: It is found unequally between the study and the controls groups

options.label: B
options.text: It is itself a risk factor for the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Confounding can be eliminated by selecting a small group

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated either with the exposure or the disease

questions.correct_answer: C. Confounding can be eliminated by selecting a small group

questions.text: Hawthrone effect is seen in :

options.label: C
options.text: The patients do not know which treatment they are receiving

questions.correct_answer: C. The patients do not know which treatment they are receiving

questions.text: All the following are true in a randomized control trial (RCT) except :-

options.label: A
options.text: Baseline characteristics of intervention are similar in both arms

options.label: B
options.text: Investigator’s bias is minimized by double blinding

options.label: C
options.text: The sample size required depends on the hypothesis

options.label: D
options.text: The dropouts from the trial should be excluded from the analysis

questions.correct_answer: D. The dropouts from the trial should be excluded from the analysis

options.label: B

questions.text: An epidemiologist wants to assess the effect of tea drinking on blood pressure. He decides to do an intervention study. Which of the following measures does not increase the internal validity of the study?

questions.text: Which of the following statement regarding live vaccines is false :

questions.text: Which of the following statement is true about the epidemiological determinants of measles :

options.label: A

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding diphtheria:
